name: mutuality
content:
mutuality noun [U]
(BEHAVIOUR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour in which two or more people or groups feel the same emotion, or do the same thing to or for each other: The building of new suburban estates undermined the mutuality of inner city communities. This mutuality demonstrates the students' social engagement with each other. Synonym
reciprocity
More examplesFewer examplesTheir relationships emphasize the need for mutuality and respect for individual differences.

mutuality noun [U]
(FINANCIAL ORGANIZATION)
the fact or principle of a financial organization being owned by its members, rather than by shareholders (= people who own shares in it): The bank is showing the value of mutuality with attractive rates for savers. The business needs to demonstrate the benefits of mutuality.
More examplesFewer examplesThe members are holding a formal vote on abandoning mutuality.The movement is based on the principles of mutuality.
